intro: Moquilea vasquezii, commonly known as the Vasquez's moquilea, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which includes many succulent species adapted to dry environments. The plant produces small, colorful flowers that bloom during the cooler months, typically in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited habitat and threats from human activity, Moquilea vasquezii is considered endangered and is protected in some areas.
